newsitem.title: USA: New York State to buy $2 mln of Utica's notes.
newsitem.headline: New York State to buy $2 mln of Utica's notes.

text.p: New York State, which had hoped that debt-ridden Utica, would solve its own problems, on Tuesday stepped in, signalling it would buy about $2 million of notes the city was struggling to sell.
An industry source, who spoke on condition of anonymity, said "(It) will probably end up purchasing a moderate amount -- $2 million."
A spokesman for the comptroller said only: "Discussions are still ongoing."
